content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's simple to solve and there are multiple ways to solve it

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good example, should not be difficult to solve.

Puzzle Name (Why all small letter?)
Alphabet String

Input
<<Line 1:>> A string [[text]] which can contain all types of characters

Output
<<Line 1:>> Each alphabet index not space seperated.
If there is any character present in the string that isn't in the English alphabet, output {{ERROR}}.

Constraints
0 ≤ length of [[text]] ≤ 256

(This can be more better)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well thought example!

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Multiple reasons:

- No constraints, not "fatal" for this clash but some like max input length would suffice
- Grammar of the statement can be better, for instance "If there is any character present in the string that isn't in the English alphabet, output ERROR"
- Some more test cases would be nice. You only test letters with index > 4 in validators.
- Some test and validators are the same, please change them. 

I know I am being a little harsh by rejecting this but it's for improving clash quality.

Input/Output sections
* Please change "char/chars" to "character/characters".

Output section
* Please change "ore" to "or".
* You may format ERROR as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.

# Too easy in Python
print(*map(ord, input()), sep="")
do you have a idee how i can balance the puzzle between the different languages?
Difficulty is not a problem (if its not 1+1) problem however is, there are many many CoCs with char -> ASCII conversion

Maybe one of the ways could be to try different language and check if there is a considerable difference? Another way to balance between languages in general could be to use "Stub generator input", if you provide good starting code for every language using the "Stub generator", then it could be more balanced. For now you do not have "print" for example in the generator, depending on the language it may need more or less typing if you do not add the "print", etc.

If you are going for CoC you have to pick good language right away. You cant make contribution equally easy for each language... Your point is invalid sentinel.

Write is necessary in stub yes, but balancing languages is bad idea

Well, the question above was specifically how to balance the puzzle between the different languages and I was answering the question.

As for if it is a good idea, it is better if contribution is balanced between languages. Winning or losing the CoC should not be too much dependent on the language that player chooses from the 25+ languages supported in the CoC to solve any puzzle – especially in Fastest or Reverse modes.

But if mode is Shortest, then some languages may always have advantage depending on a particular puzzle and it could be hard to balance in Shortest mode.

So, I conclude that more balanced a puzzle is the more desirable it is in general, especially for Fastest and Reverse modes. But for the Shortest mode there can be an exception though.
I changed the puzzle from ascii value of a text to the index in the alphabet. And when there is a none alphabet char in the text the goal is to output "ERROR".
